Name: LU 50 - Zoning, 840 Lorimer Street Rezoning, Brooklyn (C 210299 ZMK)
Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 210299 ZMK, a Zoning Map amendment (Preconsidered L.U. No. 50).

History.Description: This Resolution was Approved by Committee
A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Attachments.Name: Calendar of the Subcommittee Meetings and Land Use Meeting - April 26 and 27, 2022
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - April 28, 2022
Calendar of the Zoning Subcommittee and Land Use Meetings - May 31, 2022 and June 1, 2022
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - June 2, 2022

\viewkind4\uc1
\b0\v0\par
\b By Council Members Salamanca and Riley\b0\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, \cf1 Zucker Enterprises, LLC\cf0 ,\expndtw-6  filed an application \expndtw0 pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 13a, \cf1 eliminating from within an existing R6A District a C2-4 District, eliminating a Special Mixed Use District (MX-8), changing from an R6A District to a C4-5D District, and changing from an M1-2/R6 District to a C4-5D District, which in conjunction with the related action would \cf0 facilitate the construction of a new mixed-use development containing 74 dwelling units, 19 of which would be affordable under the Mandatory Inclusionary Housing (MIH) Program, as well as approximately 25,000 square feet of commercial floor area throughout the first three stories of the building, located at 840 Lorimer Street (Block 2679, Lot 43) in the Greenpoint neighborhood of Community District 1, Brooklyn (ULURP No. C 210299 ZMK) (the "Application");\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on April 15, 2022 its decision dated April 13, 2022 (the "Decision") on the Application;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tqr\tx9360\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1440\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7920 WHEREAS, the Application is related to application N 210300 ZRK (Pre. L.U. No. 51), a zoning text amendment to designate a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing (MIH) area with Options 1 and 2;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7560\tx7920\tx8640\tx8933\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on April 26, 2022;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the Negative Declaration issued November 29\super th\nosupersub , 2021 (CEQR No. \cf1 21DCP078K\cf0 ) which includes an (E) designation to avoid the potential for significant adverse impacts related to hazardous materials, air quality, and noise impacts (E-650) (the \ldblquote Negative Declaration\rdblquote ).\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj  \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928 RESOLVED:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx720 The Council finds that the action described herein will have no significant impact on the environment as set forth in the (E) Designation (E-650) and Negative Declaration.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj Pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 210299 ZMK incorporated by reference herein, and the record before the Council, the Council approves the Decision of the City Planning Commission.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
The Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, effective as of December 15, 1961, and as subsequently amended, is further amended by changing the Zoning Map, Section 13a:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li720\qj\cf1 1.\tab eliminating from within an existing R6A District a C2-4 District bounded by a line perpendicular to the northeasterly street line of Lorimer Street distant 135 feet northwesterly (as measured along the street line) from the point of intersection of the northeasterly street line of Lorimer Street and the northwesterly street line of Driggs Avenue, Manhattan Avenue, Driggs Avenue, and a line midway between Lorimer Street and Manhattan Avenue;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\li720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li720\qj 2.\tab eliminating a Special Mixed Use District (MX-8) bounded by a line perpendicular to the northeasterly street line of Lorimer Street distant 135 feet northwesterly (as measured along the street line) from the point of intersection of the northeasterly street line of Lorimer Street and the northwesterly street line of Driggs Avenue, a line midway between Lorimer Street and Manhattan Avenue, Driggs Avenue, and Lorimer Street;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li720\qj 3.\tab changing from an R6A District to a C4-5D District property bounded by a line perpendicular to the northeasterly street line of Lorimer Street distant 135 feet northwesterly (as measured along the street line) from the point of intersection of the northeasterly street line of Lorimer Street and the northwesterly street line of Driggs Avenue, Manhattan Avenue, Driggs Avenue, and a line midway between Lorimer Street and Manhattan Avenue; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-360\li720\qj 4.\tab changing from an M1-2/R6 District to a C4-5D District property bounded by a line perpendicular to the northeasterly street line of Lorimer Street distant 135 feet northwesterly (as measured along the street line) from the point of intersection of the northeasterly street line of Lorimer Street and the northwesterly street line of Driggs Avenue, a line midway between Lorimer Street and Manhattan Avenue, Driggs Avenue, and Lorimer Street;\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf1\line as shown on a diagram (for illustrative purposes only) dated November 29, 2021, and subject to the conditions of CEQR Declaration E-650, Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 1.\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li720\ri140\qj\tx720\tx7560\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj Adopted.\par
\par
\tab Office of the City Clerk, \}\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj The City of New York,  \} ss.:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1440\qj I hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of a Resolution passed by The Council of The City of New York on _________, 2022, on file in this office.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\par
